meanings.definition: Characterized by peculiar or unexpected traits
meanings.sent1: Her quirky sense of style always stood out.
meanings.sent2: The artist's quirky paintings were popular among art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: His quirky habit of wearing mismatched socks never failed to make people smile.
meanings.sent4: The quirky old house had a charm that was hard to resist.
meanings.sent5: The quirky cat had a habit of chasing its tail in circles.

meanings.definition: Having or showing a peculiar or eccentric personality
meanings.sent1: She is known for her quirky sense of humor.
meanings.sent2: The quirky professor always kept his students entertained.
meanings.sent3: His quirky way of telling jokes often left people laughing for hours.
meanings.sent4: The quirky character in the movie added a unique touch to the story.
meanings.sent5: The quirky neighbor was always full of surprises.

meanings.definition: A peculiar or eccentric behavior or trait
meanings.sent1: The quirky of the squirrel gathering shiny objects amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent2: His quirky often made him the center of attention at parties.
meanings.sent3: The quirky of the clown at the circus made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The quirky of the clock that only chimed at midnight was a mystery to all.
meanings.sent5: The quirky of the robot dancing to its own tune fascinated the audience.
